intro: Lippia possensis, commonly known as the Brazilian verbena, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in open woodlands or along stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits. Lippia possensis is also known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
